From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesentāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾesenˈtaɾ/ [pɾe.sẽn̪ˈt̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pre‧sen‧tar

Verb

[edit]

presentar (first-person singular indicative present presento, past participle presentáu)

  1. to present

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of presentar
infinitive presentar
gerund presentando
past participle m presentáu, f presentada, n presentao, m pl presentaos, f pl presentaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present presento presentes presenta presentamos presentáis presenten
imperfect presentaba presentabes presentaba presentábemos, presentábamos presentabeis, presentabais presentaben
preterite presenté presentasti, presentesti presentó presentemos presentastis, presentestis presentaron
pluperfect presentare, presentara presentares, presentaras presentare, presentara presentáremos, presentáramos presentareis, presentarais presentaren, presentaran
future presentaré presentarás presentará presentaremos presentaréis presentarán
conditional presentaría presentaríes presentaría presentaríemos, presentaríamos presentaríeis, presentaríais presentaríen
subjunctive present presente presentes, presentas presente presentemos presentéis presenten, presentan
imperfect presentare, presentara presentares, presentaras presentare, presentara presentáremos, presentáramos presentareis, presentarais presentaren, presentaran
imperative — presenta — — presentái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • presentable
  • presentación
  • presentador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “presentar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “presentar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin praesentāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [pɾə.zənˈta]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [pɾe.zenˈtaɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: pre‧sen‧tar
  • Homophone: presentà (except Valencian)

Verb

[edit]

presentar (first-person singular present presento, first-person singular preterite presentí, past participle presentat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. to present; to show
  2. (of people) to introduce

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of presentar (first conjugation)
infinitive presentar
gerund presentant
past participle masculine feminine
singular presentat presentada
plural presentats presentades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

future presentaré presentaràs presentarà presentarem presentareu presentaran

conditional presentaria presentaries presentaria presentaríem presentaríeu presentarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles

imperfect presentés presentessis presentés presentéssim presentéssiu presentessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres

affirmative — presenta presenti presentem presenteu presentin
negative (no) — no presentis no presenti no presentem no presenteu no presentin

Related terms

[edit]
  • presentable
  • presentació
  • presentador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “presentar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesentāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾesenˈtaɾ/ [pɾe.s̺en̪ˈt̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: pre‧sen‧tar

Verb

[edit]

presentar (first-person singular present presento, first-person singular preterite presentei, past participle presentado)

  1. to present; to show; to submit
  2. to introduce someone

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]

  • presentador

  • “presentar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

[edit]

presentar

  1. to present

Related terms

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesentāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾesenˈtaɾ/ [pɾe.sẽn̪ˈt̪aɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pre‧sen‧tar

Verb

[edit]

presentar (first-person singular present presento, first-person singular preterite presenté, past participle presentado)

  1. to present, to submit
  2. to introduce (someone), to acquaint
    Debería presentar mi nueva novia a mi familia.
    I should introduce my new girlfriend to my family.
  3. to show; to show signs of
    presenta riesgos
    run risks
    presenta dificultades
    engender difficulties
    presenta una mejora
    show signs of improvement
  4. (law) to file (a lawsuit), to lodge (an appeal, a complaint)
    Synonym: interponer
  5. (government) to table (e.g., a resolution, an amendment)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of presentar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund presentando
past participle masculine feminine
singular presentado presentada
plural presentados presentadas

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
